inn1.comm: gets a hint of outswing first up, Tharanga pushes this to mid-on. Fullish delivery
this one doesn't swing in, but Tharanga plays for it, and ends up pushing inside the line of the ball
tries the bouncer, but it is too short and too high
back of a length, just outside off, Tharanga pushes it to cover
again, plays for the non-existent swing, turning his wrists on this one, gets a leading edge towards point
this one swings ina  bit, gets the inside edge onto the pad. A stifled appeal ensues
defended with an open face, towards point. Just the one wide off the over
goes after the first delivery, it's wide, way too wide for him to go at it without moving his feet
extra bounce for Bollinger as Dilshan slashes at this, looking to go over point. Is beaten by the bounce
fuller, swings in a bit, Dilshan pushes it back to Bollinger. That he had to hurriedly get the front pad out of the way suggests he was not expecting swing
shorter, wider, left alone
and he beats the edge with a short-of-a-length delivery just outside off. Dilshan played a defensive shot inside the line
a good delivery but how well has he played this? Full and swinging in, towards off and middle, he makes room and plays with an open face, guiding it to third man for one
top shot, meets this back-of-a-length delivery with a full face, timing it well, between the bowler and mid-on
if the last ball was persuaded, this has been forced for four. Makes room and crashes this through covers. Beats the short extra cover

smart work from Watson, not so smart from Lee. Dilshan has hit this powerfully, straight to Watson at short extra cover, who throws down the non-striker's stump direct. Tharanga is back in, but Lee just has a nothing flick back at Dilshan, who gets out of the way and lets the ball go for two overthrows
placed wide of mid-on for one
pushed to cover
driven firmly, finds mid-off
short of a good length on middle, rocks back and defends it into the leg side
smashed, on the up, lands on a good length and he flays it imperiously past extra cover
around a good length just outside off, pushed on the bounce to that short extra cover fielder
straying on the pads, tickles it down towards fine leg for a single
slightly short, going down leg, was caught in two minds about playing at that one, looking to turn it into the leg side at first but then opted against it, struck on the pads
nicely timed, picked the gap very well, punched firmly off the front foot, on the up, past extra cover for a boundary
goes for the big cut immediately, this one stays low, and squeezes under the bat
Crack. Gentle short delivery, wide enough, and Dilshan gives it the treatment square on off side
full, into the pads, driven down the ground, finds mid-on
stops at him, Dilshan plays this uppishly through short extra cover from where Hussey was just moved to his left to prevent the boundaries that Dilshan has been hitting
steered to third man for a single
pushed wide of mid-on for a single
full, Tharanga mis-hits the drive to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, left alone
swings in, actually seams in after pitching, Tharanga is hit on the pad, but this is going down the leg side
back of a length, punched to cover
length ball, on the pads, pushed to mid-on
firm push from Tharanga, on the up, but can't beat mid-on. Maiden over
length ball, on off, Dilshan opens the body up, and drives it with an open face for single to sweeper-cover
length ball on the pads, not the ball to bowl to subcontinent batsmen with the fine leg in the circle. Tharanga places this wide of the man
back of a length, closer to middle now, pushed back to Watson
gets the width, steers this down to third man
opens the face on this fullish delivery, places it between point and cover-point
short of a length, on the pads, Tharanga finds Johnson at short fine leg, but Johnson has trouble finding the ball, and concedes a single
bouncer outside off, Tharanga doesn't play at it
gets a thick edge on this drive, and a single to third man
full, but swinging in, Dilshan is a touch late into the drive, finds mid-off

Inswinger. Timber. Dilshan has been a touch late with the fuller deliveries, and this one is slightly shorter than the driving length, and sneaks in through the big gap between bat and pad. Middle stump is out, Lee is thrilled
length ball, angling into the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full and wide, Sanga tries to open the face on this one, is a touch early into the shot
this one moves into the batsman, hits Tharanga on the pads. Johnson appeals, but clearly it is going down the leg side
looks to run this down square and steal a single, but has hit it straight to point
Sanga plays away from the body, on the up, towards point. He seems to trust this pitch, which has been flat
goes for the yorker, Sanga digs it out in front of leg
driven on the up again, but finds cover-point
closer to off, Sanga presses forward and plays this back to Johnson. Another maiden for Australia
loose drive well away from the body, with no foot movement at all. Is beaten by the away movement
fuller, closer to off, can't beat the cover ring
full, on the pads, can't beat square leg
beats the cover ring this time, but there is a sweeper-cover in place
length ball, angling in, pushed to mid-on, and take the single to Bollinger, who is not the quickest among the Aussies
this is full and swings away, which makes it quite handy delivery, especially since it is coming from round the stumps. Tharanga is beaten on the drive

Johnson traps Sanga on the crease, hits his pad with the late movement in, but not before there is an inside edge. They sneak in the single, Ponting has a shy at the non-striker's end, but it is Sanga who hits the stumps with his dive

Johnson strikes. His red-hot form continues. Digs this one in short, outside off, Tharanga looks to sway out of the line, but doesn't quite take the gloves out of the way. The ball doesn't quite rise up, and kisses the glove on the way
good delivery first up, pitches on a length, middle and off, seams away a touch, takes a thick edge, but Mahela's soft hands make sure it goes straight into the ground. And also wide of slip
back of a length, Mahela rides the bounce and defends this to cover
slightly too straight, and Mahela takes a single to long leg
length ball outside off, driven on the up, to mid-off
slightly dozey by Haddin, this is down the leg side, but not too wide, Haddin gets both his gloves to it, but it bounces out. Holds the hand up in apology immediately
yorker outside off, Sanga digs it out
pitches middle and off, moves away slightly, Sanga is behind the line in defence
angled across, pushed to cover
pitched on a length, angled across again, Sanga pushes forward to defend
a touch too straight, clipped off the pads, past square leg
slight shape away from Sanga, who is behind the line, and defends
floater outside off, Mahela leaves it be
closer to the stumps, too close really, and Mahela clips it off the pads for a couple
presses right forward to defend this to cover
back of a length, tucks Mahela up, who fends and keeps it down
steered to third man for a single
full, swinging in late, Sanga pushes it firmly to mid-on
the first ball drifts in nicely, but it is too full, and Mahela takes the easy single into the leg side
this is flatter, angled across, and is pushed to cover
flat again, Sanga moves across a touch, and plays this down to long-on for a single
Doherty is much better to the right-hand batsman, this drifts in again, and Mahela defends this back
more drift in towards the right-hander, but yet to see any turn. Mahela defends this outside off
quicker and flatter, defended towards cover
length ball, Sanga is forward and pushes this to cover
slower ball, doesn't drop the pace by much, but Sanga punches this on the up, straight down the ground, gets a single by the time mid-on comes around
another good offcutter from Johnson. Pitches in the channel, makes him play, and then leaves him. Beaten
slightly wider, and Mahela guides this to third man for one
full and wide, Sanga leans into the drive, gets a couple by the time sweeper-cover fields and throws
full and wide outside off, Sanga leaves this alone
angling into Mahela, who defends it back to Doherty
more drift for Doherty, but no turn, and Mahela plays it back to him
overpitched, gets an easy single to long-on
floater outside off, Sanga defends
shimmies down the ground, gets a single to long-on
short and wide, cut away to deep point for a single
angling across Mahela, who pushes this to cover
short of a length, pitched outside leg, Mahela gets inside the line, but misses. Called a wide
Mahela on his toes, and defends this to cover
full outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
full and wide to the left-hand batsman too, and he is driven to sweeper-cover again
full and wide again, squeezes it out, past point
short of a length, pitches close to off, seams in a touch, Sanga defends
tossed up, around middle and leg, defended to leg
Mahela tries the premeditated paddle, is beaten by the turn, there is an appeal for lbw, but the it is pitched just outside off, and has turned away ever so slightly
flighted generously again, Mahela comes forward and defends
slightly flat, guides this past point for a single
driven to cover
full on the pads, played late by Sanga, just around the corner for a single
full outside off, Sanga drives it towards point
length ball, wide of off, leans forward and drives it to sweeper-cover for one
dropped wide of midwicket, and they charge through for one
short of a length, seams in, Sanga gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, angling in, guided towards long leg for one
drift for Doherty, wide outside off, driven towards sweeper-cover
good flight and dip on this one, pitches around off, and holds its line. Mahela defends
waits for this one and opens the face late for a single
tossed up outside off, worked away wide of midwicket for one

Doherty gets his man, he has been frustrating Mahela with his accurate bowling and the drift that has been getting. Mahela goes for the big sweep from outside off, and places it right down deep square leg's throat
more drift here, but this is a wide down the leg side
oversteps... that's criminal for a spinner in limited-overs cricket... defended off the front foot
Chandimal charges at Dhoerty to get off the mark off a free hit, hits this powerfully down the ground, but can't beat long-on
lovely bouncer, Chandimal has no clue about this, is hit on the helmet and nearly steps on the stumps. Top stuff, accurate bouncer. Chandimal manages a smile

awesome bowling... the bouncer is followed up by the length ball, in the channel outside off. Chandimal is sitting inside the crease after that bouncer, and just leaves the bat to fry. The edge is taken. Good disciplined persistence from Australia on a flat track
length ball, seaming away slightly, Mathews is slightly opened up, but keeps it down
bouncer now, Mathews sways out of the line
drives on the up, far away from his body, manages to keep it down
length ball, pitches middle and leg, moves towards off, Mathews defends. Wicket-maiden for Bollinger
flighted outside off, pushed wide of point for one
some bite here, Doherty gets it to drift towards middle and left, and it then turns towards off. Defended
full on the pads, pushed towards midwicket
short and wide, cut away
Sanga dances down the track to get close to the pitch, and gets a single to long-on
flighted around middle and off, defended to cover
angled down the leg side for a wide
tossed up outside off, pushed past point for a single
full toss, hit straight, but misfielded by silly mid-off, which lets Mathews get his 1000th run
angled in, defended to silly mid-on
full toss outside off, driven down the ground for a single
angling across, Mathews plays with soft hands, and takes a single just wide of cover
this one turns away from Sanga, gets a thick edge for a single
short outside off, not short enough to cut, punched to cover-point
Smith has saved four here. Full and wide, nicely driven, but Smith puts in the dive at extra cover
floated outside off, pushed to point
slightly flatter, this time Sanga forces this through the cover ring for one
flighted outside off, Mathews drives it firmly to mid-off
another firm push, away from the body, towards cover
drifts in towards Sanga, who can't get it past the straight extra cover
tossed up outside off, pushed to extra cover
full toss outside off, driven down to long-on for one
Mathews presses forward and defends around his front pad
full, on the pads, can't get it past midwicket
floated wide outside off, pushed to short extra cover
length ball, around off, Sanga defends with soft hands
come down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and pushes this to long-on for one

nice nice drift, this was well outside off when it left his hand, then moved in, pitched off, and straightened a touch. Pushed to the left of Doherty, who gets a hand to it, thus beating Smith with the deviation even though he was backing up well
short now, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
Mathews leaves his crease now, gets a single to long-off
Sanga uses his feet well to come down to the pitch of this delivery, pushes this to long-on
flighted around off, Sanga comes forward and defends
jumps out of the crease again, takes this nearly on the full, gets a single to long-off
tossed up outside off, defended
full on the pads, turns this to midwicket
driven down to long-on for another single
full, into the pads, pushed to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven down to long-off for one
too far down the leg side, helped away for a single

First boundary since the 11th over, and what a beautiful shot to bring that with... comes down the track, keeps himself slightly short of the itch, and then lets his arms go through this straight loft. The high elbow provides the cherry
full outside off, good to see he doesn't fire one in after getting hit for six. Defended
flatter now, Sanga opens the face late, running it fine
strays on the pads, worked around the corner for one
shortish outside off, runs this to third man for one
length ball, pitches middle and leg, moves away towards off, defended
angled across him, Mathews punches it to sweeper-cover for one
short and wide, cut away for one
full offcutter, gets a thick edge, which goes square of third man, gets them a couple
beautiful offcutter, pitches on a length, around off, Mathews plays at it, and is beaten by the movement
and what a peach... this drifts away from Sanga, and then turns and spits... gets a thin inside edge, and Haddin is nowhere close to the ball. He appeals for something, though. Only he knows what
quicker, into the pads, worked around the corner
pushed wide of cover for one

harsh harsh call... this is drifting in the air, like a good old inswinger, lands on the guide line for wides. And the umpire spreads his arms. Give the bowlers some room, at least when they are beating the batsmen with drift!
into the pads now, turned to square leg for one
more drift for him, Mathews comes forward and defends
flatter delivery, pushed to cover
length ball, around off, Sanga pushes this to mid-off
full, on the pads, Johnson hits him on the pads, but stifles his appeal because he knows this is headed down the leg side
worked away off the pads for a single
goes for the full and straight delivery again, worked away for a single square on the on side
short ball, quick too, at 142ks, Mathews is tucked up, gets a single to third man
length ball, outside off, Sanga comes forward and defends solidly
the rare short and flat ball from Doherty, punched down to long-off for one
drifts outside off for Sanga, who pushes this with an open face for a single
lovely drift and dip, Mathews was looking to come down, but saw he was never going to get close to this, and defended
stays in his crease and defends this
short and wide, but this turns and bounce, and Mathews chooses to play it with soft hands
a quick delivery around off to end a good spell for Doherty. Mathews defends
superb yorker, swinging in late, in front of middle, but Johnson's appeal is stifled. Perhaps because he sees the ball hit the bat. I got a feeling it hit the boot first, though!
more swing into the pads, worked away for a single this time to bring up the fifty of this stand. Just one boundary in it
tucks him up with a short one, guided into the on side for a couple. The fine leg is very square
bowls a wide full toss, driven square, Ponting gets a hand to it at point, deflecting it towards sweeper-cover
short and wide, Sanga looks to run this down, gets a bottom edge well short of Haddin
bowled from behind the stumps, gets more swing into the left-hand batsman. Sanga pushes with soft hands, gets a single to mid-on
that's fifty for Sanga, through a gentle length ball on the pads, which he flicks away for a single
back of a length, moves in a touch, punched to extra cover
short of a length, just outside off, Mathews can't place this wide of Watson
fuller, into the pads, nudged into the on side for one
full ball, outside off, driven to extra cover. Smith puts in a desperate dive and saves runs, at least one
angled in, back of a length, pushed to mid-on
length ball on the pads, Mathews turns this to square leg, Sanga has to be sent back. Watson's throw is quick, but slightly wide
angled across, guided with an open face, but finds backward point
turns this around the corner for a single
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
that's tossed up higher, driven square on the off side for one
flat on the pads, worked away for one
stops a touch at him, played towards midwicket
short of a length, pushed down to long-on
bouncer, pulled away nicely, keeps it down, gets a couple by the time Hussey runs around from deep square
fuller now, pushed to long-on for an easy single
tries the yorker, around middle and leg, Sanga keeps it out
driven on the up, straight back, Watson dives and fields in his follow-through
flighted well outside off, pushed to long-off for one
Full toss! Caught at long-on! Goes for the midwicket boundary, but gets a sort of leading edge/toe end, and skies it to Johnson at long-on. Sanga can't believe it
starts off with a single down to long-on
floated outside off, worked across the line, to midwicket
presses forward to defend this back to Hussey
angled across him, placed wide of point for one
starts off with a full toss outside off, driven to deep cover for one

pushed to straight midwicket, he wants the single, Mathews doesn't. Clarke had to field in his right hand, then spin around, and throw with his left, which allowed Mendis the time get back. Nearly took Lee out with the throw, though
angled in, helped away for a single to deep square leg
full, just outside off, driven to mid-off
goes for the yorker, ends up overpitching on the pads, concedes just the single to deep square leg
full and straight, pushed back towards the bowler
angled across him, pushed to point
offcutter, Mathews stretches forward and pushes at it, it takes the edge, but third man is fine and keeps them down to one
pulled to deep square for one
pushed off the back foot, gets a single to deep cover
back of a length, around off, pushed to short midwicket. Another dot, five of them out of 11 Powerplay deliveries now
full, swinging in late, clipped away to deep square for one
driven on the up, to deep cover for just one
full and straight, flicked to long-on for one
Lovely slower bouncer, 121ks, well directed too, cramps him up. Mendis goes for the pull, gets just a tame top edge, and short fine leg does the rest
full and straight, pushed to extra cover
short one, into the ribs, Kula drops it to on, goes for a late and potentially suicidal single. Smith from square leg misses the stumps
yorker goes wrong, but Mathews only pushes this full toss to mid-off
tucked away wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, angled across, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
makes room, cuts, finds Ponting at cover-point

bouncer, angling across, pulled by Mathews, into the ground, but Watson from deep square leg has to put in a big chase to prevent it from reaching the midwicket boundary. Even then he touches the rope with the ball in hand, when putting in the slide. First boundary for Mathews

Another blow to Sri Lanka. Mathews is looking to go over extra cover, but this is pitched short of a length, and is just not the length for that shot. Ends up slicing it square on the off side, where deep cover runs around and takes a safe catch
back of a length, Malinga pushes it to cover-point
that's what you do when you call for a Powerplay. Pick a spot where the field is up, and hit over those men. Length ball, Kula opens the front leg a touch, and lofts this over mid-on
yorker now, middle and leg, can't do much with those
full, on the pads, flicked away for a couple, wide of deep square
Nice shot. Kula sees the short one, backs away, and - from outside leg - places this between point and short third man. Sri Lanka finally get a move on, but is this too little and too late?
another yorker on middle stump, Kula digs this out
low full toss, pushed just wide of mid-on for one
tucks him up with a short one, fended to cover
glanced off the hip, but the fine leg is fine, and keeps it down to one
weak shot from Malinga. Backs away and pushes at this length ball away from the body, straight to Ponting at point. Bollinger points skywards, Malinga looks down at ground as he walks back
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
bouncer, Herath has no clue when it comes and hits his top edge. However, it falls safe towards square leg
backs away and drives with an open face, reaches Ponting, who is fielding at point, on the bounce
short ball, Herath flicks at it from outside off, it falls well short of mid-on, although it does go uppishly
slower bouncer, Herath has time to face it, manages to awkwardly keeps it down for a single
goes for the wide yorker, Kula swings at it, gets the toe edge for a fine fine deflection for four
full toss outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
full, angled in towards middle and leg, Herath keeps it out
highish full toss, pushed wide of extra cover, and they can come back for two
back of a length, middle and off, pushed to mid-on
slower ball, angled across him, and he chips this over extra cover. A nice inside-out shot
short, at his body, guided to point
short and wide, cut away quite powerfully, can't beat deep point, though
pushes him onto the back foot with a shortish delivery, defended to cover
bouncer, into the chest area, Heratth gets some bat onto it, and keeps it down too. Takes the single towards square leg
another short one for Herath, who pulls this to fine leg for one
wide yorker, beats Kula's attempt to squeeze it past point
length ball, wide of off, but Kula hits it to straight extra cover
this yorker goes wrong, and he check-drives this low full toss straight of long-on for two
slower ball, wide outside off, squirted square on the off side, but Ponting at point keeps them from taking the single
short outside off, punched away stylishly, but straight to extra cover
back of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
short and wide, steered wide of third man, will come back for two
worked into the on side for a single
tucked away off the hips for one
late swing for Johnson, accurate too, this pitches middle and off, and swings in, beats the bat, hits the pad for a pretty straightforward decision for Tony Hill
bowls full and wide, Mendis's outside edge is beaten
slower ball, short outside off, looks to run this down fine, is beaten
full, just outside off, Kula clears the front leg, and hits this down to long-on for one
short of a length, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
slower short ball, pulled away to deep square leg for one
short and wide, and superbly cut away, suitably late to beat backward point. You won't be able rub that smile off his face
yorker now, around off, Mendis keeps it out
length ball, around off, driven to long-off for one
short ball, holds its line, Mendis swings well inside the line. Beaten neck and crop
Mendis goes for the big hit down the ground, doesn't reach the line of the ball just outside off
quick bouncer, but well down the leg side
straightens just a touch, gets the leading edge from Mendis, towards mid-off
Clarke drops a sitter at wide slip. Johnson had worked his man over, finally getting the outside edge with one that left him from round the stumps. But in and out!
now he bowls a wide full toss, which is slashed to third man for one
looks for the yorker, but it is slightly short of one, Mendia hits it to long-on for one
full toss outside off, driven square for a single
Clarke takes the catch now. Short of a length, Kula has an almighty heave at it, gets a leading edge, which stays forever in the sky, and Clarke completes a running catch from cover

inn2.comm: starts off with a wide down the leg side
full and straight, Watson plays for the swing, it doesn't swing that much, and takes the inside edge onto the pad
length ball, swinging away, pushed to cover. On the front foot to defend that
full and straight, Watson punches on the front foot, Malinga fields it overhead, the crowd lets out a roar
wide down the leg side, Sanga has to put in a dive to prevent the boundary
nicely guided by Haddin, past point for a single
full and straight, Watson plays straight too, towards mid-on
slower ball yorker, it looked like it would be a full toss, but dipped mid-flight, and Watson has does really well to keep this out
big inswinger as usual, Haddin punches on the up, can't beat mid-on
back of a length, moves in from well outside off, punched on the up again, to mid-off
stays deep in the crease, waits for this to swing, then closes the face late, gets two runs wide of deep backward square

loose shot... Haddin opens the front leg up, goes for a big booming cover drive, gets an inside edge, which goes past Herath at mid-on. Not a great fielding effort. Herath ran in angles, didn't dive either
back of a length, stands tall, and defends this to Kula

Sanga has taken a special catch standing up! Haddin attempts another big drive on the ump, this one doesn't swing as much as he expects it to, takes the outside edge, and straight into Sanga's gloves. Not a big deflection, but still a superb catch when you are standing up to a quick. There was a puff of dust when the ball pitched
ow full toss on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
length ball, on middle and leg, Ponting is half-forward, and defends
length ball outside off, Ponting is forward, defends this to short extra cover
slightly fuller, a slightly more certain forward lunge, pushes this to cover again
bouncer, Ponting is already forward, and then semi-ducks to avoid it

The Ponting push for four! Always good to see. Slightly more so now, for I have not seen this in a while. Lunges forward, the arms extend, the bat meets ball, no violence, but the ball follows orders, beating cover
swinging in, back of a length, turned to midwicket
slightly short of a length, Watson plays with an open face, towards point
Watson is half-forward in defending this short-of-a-length delivery
big inswinger, hits Watson who is well forward on the pad, a big shout ensues, but this was bouncing over, possibly hit him outside the line, and an inside edge can't be ruled out either
cut away powerfully, can't beat point
driven on the up, a good-looking shot, but can't beat extra cover

length ball on the pads, Ponting plays the pick-up shot, not in the air for too long, Kulasekara has to make a big chase to his left, running from deep backward square. Puts one dive in, looks like he has deflected it towards the boundary, and then puts in another effort even when sliding. Saves two runs
slower one, Ponting comes forward, delays the defensive shot a touch
short outside off, but Ponting is already forward and cannot cut this, Guides this to point
slower one on the pads, clipped to midwicket, along the ground
another slower ball, Ponting guides it to point
another slower ball, Ponting steps forward, delays the shot a touch, and then caresses this through covers. It's a five-string ring, but he has found the gap. Malinga can't believe it
angling in towards middle, gets a stride out and defends it past the bowler towards mid-on
goodish length on middle, mid-on has been pushed back, Watson crunches that firmly down the ground to steal a couple, long-on was a little wide and he made it back comfortably
in the channel outside off, gets a stride out and defends it to point
bowls it full on the off, driven down towards long-on for a single
nipped back in, landed on a good length outside off and came back to beat Ponting through the gate, struck Sanga hard on the knee

the fielder in the deep has lost that completely, there was a fielder placed at deep square leg for that flick but he just didn't see it, straying on the pads and Ponting clips that elegantly past the square-leg umpire and the fielder positioned there in the deep, Tharanga, completely messed it up, didn't see it at all
starts off with a slow (not slower, because this is his first ball) ball, Watson pushes to mid-off and takes a risky single. Makes up for it with a desperate dive in the end
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
Watson needs to calm down a touch with these singles. Again pushed straight to mid-on, and Watson is scampering back into the crease. Although here Ponting called him, and sent him back
slower ball, jumps at him a bit, Ponting takes the bottom hand off to keep it down
Ponting looks in superb touch. Another forward lunge, another push, square on the off side, beats cover-point. Silence in the stands
slower ball, too short, worked into the on side for a single
back of a length, swings in, Ponting is solid in defence
slightly shorter, slightly wider, Ponting looks to run this down. Is beaten
slightly short, slightly wide again, Ponting plays with an open face, finds cover-point

well we saw the lunge-and-push for four, and even though Kuley is not sharp, he has pulled out the dismissive pull. This is cannon fodder actually. A long hop, gentle pace, and Ponting pulls it over midwicket
gets the big front foot in again and pushes this to cover
length ball, Ponting is well forward again, and pushes this to mid-off
slow, short, takes an age to come on, Watson pulls it to midwicket
slow and shortish, runs it fine, but can't beat short third man. Didn't have any pace to work with here
slow and short again, looks to turn this to leg, but is early into the shot
Watson's first four, and what a shot. This is slightly quicker, and short, so Watson goes for the full-blooded cut, and the ball flies across the outfield
slow and short again, stays low too, Watson pulls nonetheless, on the bounce to deep midwicket
angling into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket for one
length ball, pushed back to the bowler
slower legcutter, cut away, but can't beat cover-point
Ponting is on the front foot to defend this short-of-a-length delivery
slower ball again, but angling into the pads, and Ponting has used whatever pace there is it guide it past short fine leg
back of a length, not much room, Watson punches it down the ground, to mid-off
driven on the up, wide of mid-off, gets a single
looks to run this down, but can't beat the short third man
Mathews is operating only in slower balls, this is the offcutter, stops at Watson, comes back uppishly, but well wide of Mathews
punched on the up, can't beat mid-off
this is slow, short, asking to be hit. Watson obliges with the pull
slow again, pushed to midwicket
slow, short, wide, cut wide of deep cover for two
Ponting takes this from middle, bunts it into the on side for one
Watson seemed to have made up his mind he was going to clear the front leg and go for a big one. This is the in-between length, so can neither pull nor slog-sweep. Gets the single to long-on
defended around the front pad
this is tossed up outside off, Ponting lunges forward and defends
another forward-defensive from Ponting
full on the pads, helped away for one
starts off with a carrom ball, Ponting comes forward and pushes it back
another carrom ball, just outside off, leaving him, pushed to cover
legbreak again, too full, driven to cover
starts straighter, tries the googly, but this doesn't turn, Ponting defends around the front pad
gentle full toss, Ponting pulls it to deep square for one
overpitched, Watson drives down the ground, gets a single to long-on
just a mere push down the ground, but it is a firm shot, and gets him a single
Ponting is looking as good as I have seen him in recent times, this is only slightly short, and he is back early and cuts this in front of square
too fast, too straight, and Watson glances this fine for four
now Watson manufactures the cutting length. This is slightly short, but flat, and Watson plays the late-cut, beats backward point, and the outfield is blazing quick
whoa. What a pull. Decimating Herath here. Again only slightly short, but Watson picks the length early, and pulls this over midwicket. Hits the ice box just outside the rope
a comprehensive forward-defensive to end the over
carrom ball, pitches middle and off, breaks away, gets a thick edge towards cover
Ponting well forward to defend this
the googly now, just outside off, doesn't turn much, defended
this legbreak is too short, Ponting punches this on the up, gets a single to long-off
length ball, pushed back to the bowler
slightly short, Watson rocks back early, gets a single just wide of extra cover
flighted delivery, goes with the arm, hits Watson on the pad, but is clearly headed down the leg side
the carrom ball, comes in towards Watson's pad, who punches it down t long-off for one
another carrom ball, Ponting is well forward and outside the line of off
another forward-defensive from Watson
pushed wide of mid-on for one
Watson is having his way with the bowlers now, makes room and smashes this perfectly decent delivery. Extra cover puts in a dive to keep them to one
googly, middle and leg, Watson defends
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off for one
full on the pads, worked away for a single
carrom ball, middle and off, defended back
full toss on the pads, gets a single to deep midwicket
short and asking to be pulled. Watson obliges, gets a single
swings in late - not sure if it was reverse - Watson gets a leg-bye
definite late swing for Malinga, Ponting drives, gets a bit of an inside edge towards square leg
slightly shorter, Ponting is well forward and defends
wide down the leg side, swings late, Sanga dives and saves the boundary
almost squeezes through, Watson is driving but it swings late and takes the inside edge towards fine leg. Watson reaches 1000 runs for the year. Trott at 933 is placed next
full on the pads, clipped away for a couple, wide of deep square
slower ball, into the pads, worked past short midwicket
carrom ball, pushed towards sweeper-cover for one
cut away to deep point for a single
carrom ball, not much turn, defended to cover
well forward to defend it to mid-on
cut away, but can't beat point
stays in the crease to defend this
full, straight, tailing in late, pushed down the ground, mid-on is deep
the first uncertain shot from Ponting tonight. Not a slower ball, but stops a touch, Ponting is lunging forward, but is early into the shot, and ends up chipping it right of short midwicket
that is more like Ponting, this is full and on the pads, and he plays the pick-up shot for one
full toss on the pads, Watson misses out because of the late swing

the bat-pad gap is created this time! Clatter behind Watson. Noise in the stands again. This is full and straight, starts around off, tails in late, Watson looks for a drive down the ground, but is beaten by the swing. Middle and leg stumps are disturbed
late inswing again, Clarke's bat comes down threateningly late. Keeps it out
full, just outside off, pushed to extra cover
that's fifty for Ponting. Good to see him back in form. Turns this off the pad. No reception from the crowd
nicely played by Clarke, who is forward almost instinctively and whips this wide of mid-on
slightly short, plays this late and off the back foot, finds point, though
too full, too straight, placed wide of mid-on for one

hit uppishly towards extra cover, it falls short of a diving Dilshan. It  probably stopped a touch at Ponting. Oh replays show it did in fact carry, Dilshan got a hand to it, but couldn't hold on. Mind you, he had to dive low to his right
big wide down the leg side, Sanga just gets a touch
full toss, Clarke plays it watchfully
full, swinging in, defended towards midwicket
another reversing yorker, keeps it out
brave leave - the reversing ball, starts outside off, not too wide, but Clarke lets it go. As it turns out, rightly, because it misses comfortably
another brave leave... this is a length ball, not too far outside off, but Clarke lets it go. Turns out, this isn't so brave. Malinga has overstepped
full toss down the leg side, cramps Clarke who is backing away to make room. Hit to deep square for a single
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
another bunt into the leg side for a single
cut away from in front of the stumps, finds point
big front foot down to smother the turn
leaves his crease to play the forward-defensive
comes down the track again, takes this on the full, and drives it to long-off for one
goes deep in the crease and cuts a delivery not too short. Finds point
presses forward, then goes back to defend
comes down the track, chips this over Herath's head for a single. Oh wait, this is a leading edge, but safe anyway
tossed up outside leg, no turn
too straight again, worked around the corner, with soft hands. The deep fielder has to come in to field this, and Ponting steals the second
carrom ball, no alarms for Ponting who drives it down to wide long-on for one
slightly short, Clarke is quick to rock back and cut this in front of square for one
driven powerfully to short extra, Dilshan is deceptively quick with the one-handed pick-up-and-throw. However, he misses the stumps, and concedes the overthrow
plays the chip, inside-out, on the bounce to wide long-off
forward-defensive
comes down the track, places this into the on side for another single
short and wide, cut away for a single
short again, hit down to long-off for one
helped with the angle towards square leg
the rare loose shot, Clarke throws his arms at this wide delivery, it nips in and beats the inside edge
back of a length, Clarke is on the front foot, and guides this wide of mid-on for one
comes forward to a length ball, pushes this back to the bowler
SHOT! Half-volley, just outside off, driven between the bowler and mid-off
full, on the pads, played to one of the two short midwickets
carrom ball, too short, pushed to long-off for one
punched square of the wicket, can't beat point
overpitched, placed wide of mid-on for one
Clarke picks the googly early, dances down the track, and lofts it over mid-on. Doing it easily now
carrom ball, pitches middle, leaves him, pushed back
full, on the pads, bunted into the on side for one
short outside off, makes room to cut it past point
floats it outside off, gets forward and guides it behind point
shortish outside off, punched wide of cover
imperious, Clarke is stepping up, tossed up and he sensed a chance, charged down the track, got to the pitch and smashed it high and handsome over long-on
shortish outside off, rocks back and cracks it hard to deep cover for a single
punched off the back foot to that deep cover fielder for one more
shortish on the off, rocks back to punch it down the ground to long-off for a single
slightly short on the off, gets back and plays it back to the bowler
floats it outside off, rocks forward and defends it into the off side
comes down the track and turns it wide of a diving midwicket who gets a hand to it and palms it off in the direction of long-on, the batsmen are alert enough to run back for the second
long hop, pulled away to the right of deep midwicket for a couple more to raise the 50-stand
comes down the track and tickles it down to square leg, Australia are coasting here
legbreak, around middle and off, defended to midwicket
too straight, placed perfectly between fine leg and deep square, comes back for two
the offbreak - and not the googly - but too short, and Ponting pulls this to deep midwicket
full, straight, driven down to long-on for one
googly, Ponting cuts in front of square, but finds cover
another googly, but Mendis has hardly extracted any turn. Ponting works this into the on side for one
tossed up outside off, dropped wide of cover for one
another wide tossed-up delivery, driven down to long-off for one

Review. This is an appeal for an lbw, although it has hit Ponting on the glove. That's the kind of review when the captain thinks why not use one when there are two in store. This is an offbreak that pitched middle and off, turned big, hit the glove, and Tony Hill was never interested. Good break for Sri Lanka, that's all I can say about this review
well bowled, Dilshan gets some drift away from Ponting, making him strecth, then the offbreak beats his bat, but they steal the leg-bye
full, flatter, pushed to midwicket
short, Clarke wants to pull, but this stays low, so he ends up punching this to deep midwicket
full, slight swing in, gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
full, straight, tailing in, defended
short ball, surprises Clarke, who lets it hit hie forearm
full, swings in deliciously late, Ponting tries the cover-drive, gets an inside edge for four. Rehearses the straight drive immediately after
and he now plays the straight drive, which is much more convincing although it doesn't beat mid-on
low full toss on the pads, flicked square for a single
shortish offbreak, pushed to midwicket
more drift for Dilshan, Ponting nudges this behind square on the off side, Gets a single to move to his best ODI score in Sri Lanka
Captain is denying former captain a century. Jokes apart, though, this is a superb shot. Comes down the track, is close enough to the pitch of the ball, and goes inside-out over wide long-off
beautifully bowled, but dropped by Sanga. This is lightly flat, holds its line, takes a healthy edge, goes into the glove and out
comes down the track to drive this to long-off for one
flighted delivery, pushed to midwicket
full, late inswinger, clipped away uppishly, but wide of square leg
late-swinging yorker, Ponting keeps this out
length ball, driven on the up, finds mid-on
the yorker goes wrong, slightly too full, slightly too straight, and Ponting deflects it to fine leg for four
gets this yorker right, Ponting digs it out in front of off
short, Ponting gets under it, called wide. Slightly down the leg side, I think
full, just outside off, digs this out for a single
slightly short, Ponting punches this to sweeper-cover for a single
good turn and bounce this time, from middle and leg, Clarke pushes this to cover
full, on the pads, bunted into the on side for a single
plays the forward-defensive with an open face, gets a single wide of point
angling into the pads, turning away, played against the turn to take a single around the corner
tossed up around middle and leg, pushed to extra cover
Shot! Clarke dances down the track, and crashes this inside-out, between mid-off and extra cover, all along the ground
yorker outside off, digs it out
short ball, Clarke feasts on it even though he has committed to the front foot. He pulls this from outside off, over midwicket
full, outside off, squeezed square, J Mendis makes a diving save at point
full toss outside off, driven square for a single
digs this yorker out
cut in front of square for one
full, on the pads, pushed to midwicket
another defensive shot towards midwicket
even at this stage, Malinga makes a diving save at backward-point to deny Australia three runs
fine paddle-sweep from Ponting, comes back for two
tossed up, driven back to the bowler
short to start off, punched to extra cover
chips down the track, pushes this to midwicket
tossed up around middle and leg, defended
Clarke comes down the track, takes this on the full, and gets a single to long-off
flighted generously, Ponting drives, but can't beat the straight extra cover
full and down the leg side, Ponting tries the paddle, seems to have made contact because it is not called wides
pushed wide of midwicket for one
Clarke cuts this in front of square for four, removes his helmet, hugs Ponting, and the duo then starts shaking the Sri Lankans' hands
